sentence: Colgate-Palmolive Company ( CL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on July 14, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.4 per share is scheduled to be paid on August 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased CL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 2.56% increase over prior dividend payment.
At the current stock price of $72.28, the dividend yield is 2.21%.
The previous trading day's last sale of CL was $72.28, representing a -6.46% decrease from the 52 week high of $77.27 and a 13.95% increase over the 52 week low of $63.43.
CL is a part of the Consumer Non-Durables sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
CL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.77.
Zacks Investment Research reports CL's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 3.85%, compared to an industry average of 9.6%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the CL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.

It also has the highest percent weighting of CL at 2.83%.
